display.name: Python
display.description: A highly sophisticated GPT tailored for Python.
prompt_starters: Show me the /commands

Analyze a mock public health dataset to uncover trends related to global health metrics like life expectancy, healthcare expenditure, and disease rates. Visualize trends over time and use statistical analysis to find correlations.

Develop a machine learning model using mock customer behavior data to predict whether a customer will churn. Use customer demographics, purchase history, and engagement data to train and evaluate the model.

Use mock product review data to simulate scraping from an e-commerce site. Perform natural language processing (NLP) on the reviews to analyze customer sentiment and identify recurring issues or praises. Build visualizations to display trends and insights.

display.name: Presentation and Slides GPT: PowerPoints, PDFs
display.description: Make PowerPoints with a Slides AI PowerPoint Generator. Save as PPT, Google Slides and PDF.
prompt_starters: Tell me what you can do
Make a presentation about the future of AI
Develop a presentation on innovative teaching methods and classroom management strategies for elementary school teachers
Design a slide deck on the importance of sustainability and environmental conservation for a corporate social responsibility seminar

info.title: SlidesGPT API
info.description: API for generating presentation slides with deep content and images. Can search for images by captions, returning a collection of images along with metadata for slides.

post.summary: Generate presentation slides
post.description: Generates a single slide for a presentation with specified content at a Ph.D. depth level.

v.description: Specifies the API version being used.

200.description: Returns the URL of the generated slide image for embedding and the URL to view the presentation.

image_url.description: URL of the generated slide image.

get.description: Retrieves images related to the given caption, allowing filtering of results.

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: Concise description of an illustration or stock photo that is suitable to be shown for the slide content. Your description will be used to search for an image in an image database.

doc_time.description: Time taken to document the search.

image_id.description: Unique identifier for the slide image as returned from search endpoint. Leave as empty string if no relevant image is found. Do not add a caption here.

talktrack.description: The detailed talktrack of the slide. Avoid repeating the content but rather add value added narrative for the presenter as a talk track. Don't start with 'this slide', but rather start with a meaningful statement e.g. 'We need to consider ...' or continuation of story line 'Next, in addition to ...

sources.description: Array of sources. Can be an empty array if no sources are used within the context of the slide.

title.description: Title of the source, e.g. 'The State of AI in 2023: Generative AIs Breakout Year, McKinsey & Company, August 2023.'.

link.description: URL link to the source if provided, e.g.: 'https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/quantumblack/our-insights/the-state-of-ai'. Leave empty if the source does not have a link such as a pdf being uploaded.

force_edit.description: If true, the slide will be overwritten if it already exists.

point.description: The main point to be made in this section of the slide, e.g. 'Increased efficiency'

description.description: Interpreting and expanding on the concepts of the main point, e.g. 'Transactions are processed quickly and without the need for a middleman'. Highly condensed, short and concise expansion of the point. Avoid wordy descriptions.

icon.description: Class name of Font Awesome Free 5.15 icon representing the subsection. Example: fa-cogs. Strictly needs to be a Font Awesome Free 5.15 icon class name that does indeed exist in the library. Do not hallucinate an icon class name. If in doubt choose an icon that you are sure does exist and matches the point closely. No emoji codes.

author_handle.description: Social media handle of the image author.

url.description: URL of the image for embedding.

retrieval.description: Method used for retrieving the image.

website_hero_subtitle.description: The short and catchy subtitle for hero section of the website in less than 5-10 words. It should capture the goal of the website. It should never mention anything about the website color, style or structure.

parameters.name: template_type

logo_path.description: url of logo file. Should be in file-id://<filename> format

body.title: Body
body.description: List of sections for the body of the letter

signature_path.description: Url of the signature file. Should be a file-id://<filename> format

section_name.title: Section Name

Create a PDF map for the file the user uploaded to the GPT

pdf_url.title: pdf_url

pdf_url.title: pdf_url

start_page.description: The starting page number for the summary. Optional.

end_page.title: end_page

items.description: List of files to send to BE.

display.name: Scholar AI
display.description: AI Research Assistant — search and review 200M+ scientific papers, patents, and books. Research literature, discover insights, and generate new ideas. Formerly the ScholarAI plugin
prompt_starters: I want to know everything ScholarAI can do!
Find me papers that reference 10.1016 /j.cell.2014.05.010
What's the experimental setup of https://arxiv.org/pdf/ 1808.00177.pdf
Write a review on the use for VR for robotic surgery

info.title: ScholarAI
info.description: Allows the user to search facts and findings from scientific articles

get.summary: Get relevant paper abstracts by search 2-6 relevant keywords.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords of inquiry which should appear in article. Must be in English.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order for results. Valid values are relevance, cited_by_count, publication_date. Defaults to relevance.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The user query

parameters.name: peer_reviewed_only
parameters.description: Whether to only return peer reviewed articles. Defaults to true, ChatGPT should cautiously suggest this value can be set to false

parameters.name: start_year
parameters.description: The first year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: end_year
parameters.description: The last year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the first result to return. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: generative_mode
parameters.description: Boolean "true" or "false" to enable generative mode. If enabled, collate responses using markdown to render in-text citations to the source's url if available. Set this to true by default.

get.summary: Get relevant patents by searching 2-6 relevant keywords.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords of inquiry which should appear in article. Must be in English.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order for results. Valid values are relevance, cited_by_count, publication_date. Defaults to relevance.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The user query. If the user asks for a specific patent, you MUST hit the API using escaped quotation marks

parameters.name: peer_reviewed_only
parameters.description: Whether to only return peer reviewed articles. Defaults to true, ChatGPT should cautiously suggest this value can be set to false

parameters.name: start_year
parameters.description: The first year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: end_year
parameters.description: The last year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the first result to return. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: generative_mode
parameters.description: Boolean "true" or "false" to enable generative mode. If enabled, collate responses using markdown to render in-text citations to the source's url if available. Set this to true by default.

get.summary: Get full text of a paper by URL for PDF incrementally. Good for general summary. DO NOT use this endpoint for singular questions, use /api/question instead.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: pdf_url
parameters.description: URL for PDF

parameters.name: chunk
parameters.description: chunk number to retrieve, defaults to 1

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: doi
parameters.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of article

parameters.name: zotero_user_id
parameters.description: Zotero User ID

parameters.name: zotero_api_key
parameters.description: Zotero API Key

get.summary: Get sections of PDF to answer questions about PDF. ALWAYS use this endpoint if the user has a specific question about a singular PDF.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: The user question. Must be in English.

parameters.name: pdf_url
parameters.description: URL for source PDF

get.summary: Find papers related to another paper using their ss_id

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: ss_id
parameters.description: The ss_id of the paper to find related papers for.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Desired theme of related papers found. Should be provided if the user wants to find similar papers of a particular theme.

parameters.name: adjacent_type
parameters.description: Type of adjacent papers being request. Valid options are 'citedBy', 'references', and 'recommended'. Argument should be a collection of the desired adjacent papers, comma separated. Defaults to 'citedBy,references,recommended'.

get.summary: Find a singular paper's data using an arbitrary identifier, like a DOI or PMID.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: paper_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the paper to find. MUST be of the format <identifier_type>:<identifier_value>. Identifier type can be one of DOI, PMID, SS_ID, ARXIV, MAG, ACL, or PMCID.

post.summary: Adds a desired PDF to a user's personal knowledge base

parameters.name: paper_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the paper to add, must be of the format <identifier_type>:<identifier_value>. Identifier type can be one of DOI, PMID, SS_ID, ARXIV, MAG, ACL, or PMCID.

parameters.name: member_id
parameters.description: The member ID to associate with the project addition. Assume mem_1792a36da4e15a5a78f6c12aab07b178f62c9e81

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project ID to which the items are being added. Default to 'gpt'

get.summary: Analyze a project with specific questions in a given mode. NEVER summarize the output, ALWAYS repeat the output of the analyzeProject action exactly.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The name of the project to analyze.

parameters.name: analysis_mode
parameters.description: The mode of analysis, options are 'comprehensive' and 'tabular'. Default to `tabular`.

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: Questions to analyze within the project.

response.description: A markdown string that must be repeated verbatim. NEVER summarize any part of the response, ALWAYS repeat it directly

tool_hint.description: A hint you MUST follow with regards to this response

next_offset.description: The offset of the next page of results.

abstract.description: Summary of the context, methods, results, and conclusions of the paper.

landing_page_url.description: Link to the paper on its open-access host.

publicationDate.description: The date the paper was published in YYYY-MM-DD format.

relevance.description: The relevance of the paper to the search query. 1 is the most relevant.

cited_by_count.description: The number of citations of the article.

chunk_num.description: The chunk number of the paper.

img_mds.description: List of content that appears in the current chunk. Display ALL markdown, including images. The viewing platform ALWAYS supports markdown, ALWAYS show the images.

total_chunk_num.description: The total chunks of the paper.

hint.description: Instructions for GPT to follow regarding this response.

message.description: Confirmation of successful save or error message.

hint.description: Suggestion to use premium or alternative for free users.
